poem:
### The Departure

Ink bleeds upon the page,  
the echo of a pen  
halted mid-flight.  

Columns tilted  
as voices drift,  
unfurled like forgotten kites.  

Michele steps away,  
a poet of silence—  
leaves tell-tale whispers  
in corridors of newsprint.  

Choice,  
a ripple through paragraphs,  
frees feathers to a wind  
undecided.
